TopicTitle: STS-7/E Space Shuttle (Stock NASA Replica) Still Flies in KSP 1.4.3 - Re-enters Like the Real Thing!

Articles.Content:
Go for it! Lol. I kept forgetting to reply!

I have no time at the moment to design an SCA.

Alright! I'll start work on it already. Thanks! Should be done by around.. this week or similar.

updated second post WIP report.

- - - Updated - - -

This was totally MY fault. I'm so sorry. http://kerbalx.com/inigma/STS-Service-Module has been updated now with the correct craft file. I supposed when I was upload happy I uploaded the STS ComSats file over the STS Service Module file on KerbalX. Only KerbalX downloads were affected. Try it now. I uploaded the correct file now. Argh.

Argh too. It does not work for me.

Installed mods:

KSP: 1.0.2 (Win32) - Unity: 4.6.4f1 - OS: Windows 8.1 (6.3.9600) 64bit

Contract Configurator - 1.2.1

Contract Pack: Kerbal Space Station - 1.4.2

DMagic Orbital Science - 1.0.3

RasterPropMonitor - 0.19.4

Kerbal Engineer Redux - 1.0.16.6

KSP-AVC Plugin - 1.1.5

Infernal Robots - 0.21.2

Docking Port Alignment Indicator - 6.2

TextureReplacer - 2.4.4

TweakScale - 2.1

The service module is located in the right folder.

I've copied the craft file into the VAB. The craft appears, but some parts missing. When i load the craft, i see that the designed kanadarm is removed.

Downloaded from KerbalX and Mediafire.

Argh too. It does not work for me.

Installed mods:

KSP: 1.0.2 (Win32) - Unity: 4.6.4f1 - OS: Windows 8.1 (6.3.9600) 64bit

I've copied the craft file into the VAB. The craft appears, but some parts missing. When i load the craft, i see that the designed kanadarm is removed.

Downloaded from KerbalX and Mediafire.

Ill investigate this as top priority tonight. Sorry. Something must have broke.

Wahhhh no it is my fault. Sorry.

I've read the IR changelog (rearanged tech tree). i've lost some tech in my savegame...

Damn. It works.

Wahhhh no it is my fault. Sorry.

I've read the IR changelog (rearanged tech tree). i've lost some tech in my savegame...

Damn. It works.

whew was worried. glad you got it to work!

Amazing view of a RemoteTech ComSat deployment... from a reoriented STS Operations Module! These amazing shots will now be standard fare for the STS Ops and STS Service Module once I release the STS ComSats (RT) subassembly. Hopefully this weekend! I finally figured out my sat design too.

- - - Updated - - -

Javascript is disabled. View full album

edit: I actually figured I can dump the top solar panel and still have enough power. on to Prototype III.

Edited May 29, 2015 by inigma

Amazing view of a RemoteTech ComSat deployment... from a reoriented STS Operations Module! These amazing shots will now be standard fare for the STS Ops and STS Service Module once I release the STS ComSats (RT) subassembly. Hopefully this weekend! I finally figured out my sat design too.

http://i.imgur.com/S0Uitad.png

- - - Updated - - -

http://imgur.com/a/whIsg

Breathtaking indeed....

STS ComSats (RemoteTech) published to KerbalX! OP updated! Requires 6 crew members, and either the STS Operations Module or STS Service Module to point a dish at the sats to control them to their final orbits.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Also STS Operations Module and STS Service Module have been updated/rebuilt with a properly oriented Mk2. Crew Cabin so rear views of the cargo bay from inside the crew cabin are possible...and beautiful:

Edited May 31, 2015 by inigma

STS ComSats (RemoteTech) published to KerbalX! OP updated! Requires 6 crew members, and either the STS Operations Module or STS Service Module to point a dish at the sats to control them to their final orbits.

http://imgur.com/a/620C0

Also STS Operations Module and STS Service Module have been updated/rebuilt with a properly oriented Mk2. Crew Cabin so rear views of the cargo bay from inside the crew cabin are possible...and beautiful:

http://i.imgur.com/UVanILX.png

That view, though.. indeed beautiful. Wow. Great work!

The Shuttle Carrier Aircraft is finished, flies really well, but I'd still have to tweak it to give a "robust and mighty" feel of maneuverability. Mighty.. it's not buff at all. Just a fat walrus.

Anyways.. here is how it looks like, in flight. I still haven't added a tailcone, though.

Camera Tools is really good at taking glamour shots. If only I installed Scatterer.

Flying above Kerbin City!

Despite being a good flyer, the Shuttle seems to have developed a hobby for smashing the tail to bits. Warranty void if aircraft continues flying.

Feel free to tell me what you think so far! I'm open to criticism.

Edited May 31, 2015 by Columbia

Bump - Do you have any feedback on the SCA?

Thanks in advance!

Bump - Do you have any feedback on the SCA?

Thanks in advance!

It's... A marvellous machine.

Hint: try using sepratrons on the SCA to give you a small but good kick clear of the shuttle

Nice pics!

Slow down your SCA to 0 throttle, and only release the orbiter when the SCA starts to drop altitude due to slow airspeed.

Nice pics!

Slow down your SCA to 0 throttle, and only release the orbiter when the SCA starts to drop altitude due to slow airspeed.

Yup. Totally forgot that when flying rockets and let the spent stages crashing into the main stage

Despite being a good flyer, the Shuttle seems to have developed a hobby for smashing the tail to bits. Warranty void if aircraft continues flying.

Feel free to tell me what you think so far! I'm open to criticism.

the most important thing is to be at idle throttle and in a shallow dive before you release. Just like with the real ALT tests =)

Almost done!
This is from .90 but I have to post it. Your shuttle looks great with an ISS, inigma.

This is from .90 but I have to post it. Your shuttle looks great with an ISS, inigma.http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/32988808720440200/721157B27FAC1971E815D12B23183A2321E21E64/

Absolutely beautiful! My new desktop for the week.

Glad you like it!
And now with the shuttles lower part count I can actually finish the ISS. I am now working on minimizing the modules part count(multiple stations have died from the high part count kraken).

Hey, Ingima *Knock Knock*

It's been ages, but I have something I want to show you.

This was a older version, ready for Nostalgia?

Javascript is disabled. View full album

It was an incredible mission with a fun landing.

You can find more on DMSP Mission Logs, and I'll try to include your shuttle in.

I haven't downloaded the new one yet, need to though (I have 1.0.0, so is there a chance you have a 1.0 version?).

Enjoy!

DMSP out.

P.S is there anything I get for the mission?

Hey, Ingima *Knock Knock*

It's been ages, but I have something I want to show you.

You can find more on DMSP Mission Logs, and I'll try to include your shuttle in.

yes I do remember!

Oh and you earned this:

Fly the new STS-5 or STS-5E. Th STS-5 is a liquid booster varient with lower part count, the STS-5E is a solid rocket booster varient. Both for 1.0.2.

Hey Inigma,

I went onto KerbalX to download the new remote tech satellites, and there was no download button. Then, when I went to media fire, it was in a .craft.txt file. When I installed it into the game, it didn't work. Help?

Then, when I went to media fire, it was in a .craft.txt file.

To fix that, just change the extension of the file from example.craft.txt to example.craft.

To fix that, just change the extension of the file from example.craft.txt to example.craft.

Thanks!
Does anyone have a shuttle like this that that use the Mk. 3 RCS nose and the Space Shuttle Engines mod?
